image.altText: An office building with at least seven floors. The building has multi-coloured cladding.

props.synopsis: Four Corners has uncovered allegations of conflicts of interest and pro-industry bias at the country's part-time regulator responsible for Australia's biggest betting companies.

title.children: The gambling regulator's alleged 'cosy relationship' with the $50b betting industry

image.altText: A police officer stands watch over a street.

props.synopsis: NSW Police said the alleged gunman was "firing indiscriminately at passing vehicles including police vehicles".

title.children: Man in critical condition after shooting in Sydney's inner west

image.altText: A grey fighter jet close up in teh sky.

props.synopsis: Department of Defence emails show that a website dedicated to Australia's role in the global F-35 supply chain used by Israel to maintain its jet fighters was removed at the start of the war in Gaza.

title.children: Emails show government 'quietly' removed F-35 website at start of Gaza war

image.altText: Man looking at for sale sign for apartment.

props.synopsis: The national project to fix housing affordability is off to a slow start but, from deposit schemes and negative gearing to immigration and construction delays, the reasons are complex.

title.children: Why are house prices accelerating? It's complicated

image.altText: A black sausage dog with tan highlights around the muzzle turns its head.

props.synopsis: Valerie's disappearance on South Australia's Kangaroo Island unleashed a 529-day hunt. She dodged rescue attempts and traps and had some wondering whether the sausage dog was mocking them and having the time of her life.

title.children: How Valerie became the world's most notorious sausage dog

image.altText: Two men celebrate after scoring a try

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Broncos are flash and have never made apologies for it but as the dust settles on their premiership win they've also proven they have the true steel of champions.

title.children: Why Brisbane's NRL premiership win is more about blood than gold

image.altText: ece Walsh of the Broncos celebrates winning the NRL Grand Final match

props.synopsis: The internet could barely believe what was happening as Brisbane, fuelled by Reece Walsh's brilliance, came from behind to win the NRL grand final.

title.children: How the internet reacted to Brisbane winning the NRL grand final

image.altText: The Broncos score a controversial try

props.synopsis: Brisbane and the Roosters played one of the greatest games in NRLW history, but the controversial winning try to Mele Haufanga shapes as a football mystery that might never be solved.

title.children: Try that decided NRLW premiership lingers as an unsolvable mystery

image.altText: An elderly woman standing in front of a burnt out car on a street.

props.synopsis: Authorities say nine regions across Ukraine were targeted by Russian night-time drone, missile and aerial bomb strikes.

title.children: Zelenskyy slams latest Russian 'aerial terror'

image.altText: Two F1 cars make wheel-to-wheel contact during a race.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has been left furious at his teammate, and his team, after his two drivers' championship rivals gained ground on him in the Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix.

title.children: 'That's not fair': Piastri's F1 lead cut after Norris makes lap one contact

image.altText: Older woman holds her hands over her chest.

props.synopsis: Australian women having a heart attack are less likely to be promptly diagnosed and treated compared to men, although the gender gap in cardiac care is narrowing.

title.children: Gender gap in heart attack care narrowing, but not fast enough, research finds

image.altText: an aerial view of a large stadium on the hobart waterfront

props.synopsis: The future of Tasmania's proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium rests in the hands of the state's politicians. So who will vote which way, and what is the chance it will actually get up?

title.children: Who are the upper house MLCs deciding the Hobart stadium's fate?

image.altText: A fire at the beach

props.synopsis: A "careless" campfire lit during a fire ban sparked a rapidly moving blaze that has now burnt hundreds of hectares on Moreton Island, according to authorities.

title.children: Campfire during ban blamed for Moreton Island fire

image.altText: A man in a suit smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: An afternoon tea meeting with a president is not the sort of invitation you get every day as a foreign correspondent, but when I met Finland's Alexander Stubb in Helsinki, it taught me a lot about another world leader.

title.children: I got an unexpected afternoon tea invite, and it told me a lot about Trump

image.altText: Rescuers in hi-vis clothing looking underneath two large, collapsed concrete building layers covered in rubble

props.synopsis: The number of students confirmed dead after the collapse of an Islamic boarding school building in Indonesia has risen to 37, from 16 a day earlier, the country's disaster mitigation agency says.

title.children: Death toll rises to 37 as more student bodies are recovered in school collapse

image.altText: People in black raincoats wade through water.

props.synopsis: Heavy rains have triggered landslides and flash floods, blocking roads, washing away bridges and killing dozens in Nepal and West Bengal, authorities said.

title.children: Dozens dead after landslides, flash floods in Nepal and India

image.altText: Ray Martin speaks to the room.

props.synopsis: After six decades as a journalist, Ray Martin says he has learnt the secret to a long and satisfying career.

title.children: After 60 years, one piece of advice keeps this 80-year-old journalist from retiring

image.altText: A crowded beach in front of a city skyline.

props.synopsis: Temperatures could soar to almost 10 degrees above average this week, increasing the risk of bushfires that are already burning across the state.

title.children: Spring heatwave increases fire risk as scores of blazes burn in Queensland

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in a blue suit and white shirt speaking to someone out of frame.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has deployed 300 Illinois National Guard troops to Chicago after Governor JB Pritzker refused to do so.

title.children: Trump authorises deployment of 300 National Guard troops to Chicago

image.altText: Man and woman together at a dinner table

props.synopsis: Nathalie Matthews, 38, was arrested after arriving into Sydney on a flight from Dubai this morning.

title.children: Mark Latham's ex-partner charged with sharing intimate images

image.altText: Bread, jam, biscuits, dip, muesli bars and sausages on a white background.

props.synopsis: The main ingredient in dozens of supermarket products has been reduced, an ABC investigation has found, leading retail and marketing experts to call for more transparency around recipe changes.

title.children: Why you might be paying more for reduced quality at the supermarket

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, in a dark suit, leans against the wall of a brick home.

props.synopsis: It takes a long time to build anything at all in Australia's dysfunctional housing market, even for the federal government, but Labor's social housing fund is inching towards an impact.

title.children: Building homes like the one the PM grew up in is turning out to be harder than it sounds

image.altText: A man in a hood poses in front of a computer with the anonymous logo on it.

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity analysts warn that three of the most notorious English-speaking cybercrime groups are still operating as the "super group" known as Trinity of Chaos, despite recently announcing retirement.

title.children: Inside the 'Trinity of Chaos': How young hackers are uniting to hit big companies

image.altText: A group of rifles laid out in a row on the floor.

props.synopsis: More than 100 firearms are seized in a WA Police operation targeting 'sovereign citizens' in the wake of the fatal shooting of two Victorian officers.

title.children: ‘A risk we cannot take’: Police seize 135 guns amid sovereign citizen raids

image.altText: A woman with short black hair speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Sanae Takaichi has won Japan's Liberal Democratic Party's leadership contest and is likely to become the country's first female PM. Here's what we know about her.

title.children: Once a rock drummer, Sanae Takaichi is set to become Japan's first female PM

image.altText: Lady standing side on to camera with earrings that say "Stop violence against woman".

props.synopsis: Larissa Waters says she will be looking closely at the Robbins Island wind farm, which the Greens's two Tasmanian senators say will threaten several endangered species.

title.children: Greens leader 'doesn't know very much' about wind farm opposed by colleagues

image.altText: A man in a suit kisses a woman in a wedding dress

props.synopsis: The event was part of a government campaign aiming to make civil weddings more accessible across the country.

title.children: Mass wedding ceremony in Paraguay sees thousands say 'I do' in unison

image.altText: Two large space antennas surrounded by trees and red dirt in New Norcia.

props.synopsis: A second deep space antenna opened in a tiny monastic town in Western Australia could help unlock the secrets of the universe.

title.children: The new antenna that could theoretically receive a phone call from Mars

image.altText: A basketball player in black holds out his arm with players in white either side of him and ball to his right

props.synopsis: The New Orleans Pelicans have outclassed the South East Melbourne Phoenix 127-92 to conclude their two-game Australian tour.

title.children: Pelicans complete Australian tour with dominant win over Phoenix

image.altText: A sign prohibiting drones at Munich Airport.

props.synopsis: In total, around 30 flights and nearly 6,000 passengers were impacted by the closures.

title.children: Lithuania's Vilnius Airport reopens after balloon sightings in airspace

image.altText: a boat in a port with shipping containers around it

props.synopsis: A $20 million loan from the Tasmanian government to keep smelter Liberty Bell Bay afloat after it flagged financial woes earlier this year has led to the first shipment of ore being delivered.

title.children: Premier calls on Tasmanian smelter to 'crack on with it' after ore woes

image.altText: Sailors and women on the Rotor at Sydney's Luna Park in the 1940s.

props.synopsis: Now in its 90th year, Sydney's Luna Park was not always so family-friendly.

title.children: Segregation, sex work and Sydney: Luna Park's forgotten history

image.altText: Sean Diddy Combs looking at something with sunglasses on

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs may have just been sentenced to four years in prison, but he still faces a mountain of lawsuits accusing him of sexual violence and other misconduct.

title.children: Here's what's next for Diddy now he's been sentenced to four years in prison

image.altText: Aluminum containers containing rice, tofu, fried fish, vegetables, and melon slices.

props.synopsis: The key election commitment of President Prabowo Subianto is facing mounting backlash over its poor oversight, questionable food sourcing and unhygienic kitchens.

title.children: Indonesia's free meal program poisons thousands of children

image.altText: Close up of a blood red moon.

props.synopsis: Can a full moon affect your periods? A new study suggests there's a link, but others say there's little evidence. We look at the facts and debunk some myths.

title.children: Menstrual myths debunked: What does your cycle sync with?
